moduleMetadataJson.name: DNS BailiWicked Domain Attack
moduleMetadataJson.description:
This exploit attacks a fairly ubiquitous flaw in DNS implementations which
        Dan Kaminsky found and disclosed ~Jul 2008.  This exploit replaces the target
        domains nameserver entries in a vulnerable DNS cache server. This attack works
        by sending random hostname queries to the target DNS server coupled with spoofed
        replies to those queries from the authoritative nameservers for that domain.
        Eventually, a guessed ID will match, the spoofed packet will get accepted, and
        the nameserver entries for the target domain will be replaced by the server
        specified in the NEWDNS option of this exploit.
author: I)ruid <druid@caughq.org>
hdm <x@hdm.io>
Cedric Blancher <sid@rstack.org>

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: SNAPLEN
options.description: The number of bytes to capture

options.name: TIMEOUT
options.description: The number of seconds to wait for new data

options.name: RHOSTS
options.description: The target host(s), range CIDR identifier, or hosts file with syntax 'file:<path>'

options.name: GATEWAY_PROBE_HOST
options.description: Send a TTL=1 random UDP datagram to this host to discover the default gateway's MAC

options.name: GATEWAY_PROBE_PORT
options.description: The port on GATEWAY_PROBE_HOST to send a random UDP probe to (random if 0 or unset)

options.name: SRCADDR
options.description: The source address to use for sending the queries (Accepted: Real, Random)

options.name: SRCPORT
options.description: The target server's source query port (0 for automatic)

options.name: NEWDNS
options.description: The hostname of the replacement DNS server

options.name: XIDS
options.description: The number of XIDs to try for each query (0 for automatic)

options.name: TTL
options.description: The TTL for the malicious host entry
